Douglas Duds are air conatoned on the ground as well as I g
Up to 50 miles an hour faster to Panama, Guayaquil,
Lima, Santiago, Buenos Aires.
• As you streak South on Panagra's new DC-7B's, you
gain a new concept of luxury in the air.
Wide seats have dual foot rests. Cushions and
curved head rests are especially designed for extra
comfort in flight. And there are twice as many berths
as ever before.
Complimentary Gourmet Galley service includes
high tea, canapes, cocktails, champagne, cordials.
All meals are served on snowy cloths with gleaming
silver and crystal.
Panagra's swift, sleek DC-7B's are up to 50 miles
an hour faster than any other airliner to the West Coast
of South America and Argentina.
This summer a fleet of DC-7B's will be used for
daily deluxe El InterAmericano service. Leave Miami
at 9:30 P.M. (Miami to Panama over PAA's route)
and be in Buenos Aires next afternoon... having
covered a distance equal to nearly twice that between
New York and London.
For reservations on El InterAmericano or on
El Pacifico, tourist service by DC-6B, call your Travel
Agent or Pan American, Panagra's U. S. Sales Agent.
Pan American-Grace Airways

properties.sfomuseum:description: Two-page advertisement from October 1949 issue of Holiday promoting Panagra, titled “Swift new luxury service to South America by Panagra’s new DC-7B’s equipped with radar”; color illustration depicting profile view of Panagra aircraft against pictorial map of South America.
